column4: wordpress requires a !LAMP setup (i.e. apache+php+mysql) -- why don't you install the package from the repositories?
anyone know how to install wordpress on hardy
ah unop... i did it from the repos but its an older version and didn't install lamp
any way to get 2.6 from repos or is there another repos for 2.6
by LAMP i mean apache, mysql and php - installing wordpress automatically pulls these in
i guess it did install that but how do i launch it now
i dont see it in the menus
2.3.3 is the latest in hardy - if you need a newer version, you need to install from source (svn as you mentioned)
i did that too... guess all i can't figure out is how to launch it
I'm not sure how you use wordpress either -- all i know is it's something that runs atop a webserver
that what i read too... guess ill keep asking around if anybody might know
did you compile anything after checking wordpress out from the SVN respository?
i though it installed it on its own
no, that only downloads the source code, you need to do the usual build process as per the INSTALL / README file in the source folder
in the directory where you issued the SVN command
i found a how to for it... i'll give that a try
